channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: COVID-19 did not come from a lab, Filipino epidemiologist stresses
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "We’ve also heard of this controversial theory that the virus came from a lab, and fortunately many academic voices have already spoken to refute this theory," he said.

item.title: Hospital groups rate DOH coronavirus response '10/10', rally behind Duque
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: However, the statement did not specifically address any of the accusations thrown against Duque.

item.title: 'Critical but not seditious,' journalist, artists say of papers in halted Bulacan relief drive
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: “The zine reminds us of the crucial role played by the peasant sector as food producers in ensuring health for all Filipinos,” says Donna Miranda, SAKA spokesperson and public health communicator.

item.title: Ship crew faces 14 more days of quarantine after weeks afloat in uncertainty
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: On Monday, April 20, their cruise ship, owned by an Australian shipping line, was finally allowed to lay anchor. But the ship and others also waiting for instructions remain in limbo over changing quarantine protocols.

item.title: RITM to assess reliability of FDA-approved rapid test kits
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: In a statement Thursday, Food and Drug Administration Director General Enrique Domingo said the evaluation of RITM, the national reference laboratory for emerging diseases, will guide the public in selecting the kits they will use for testing.

item.title: Warrantless arrest of Cebuano artist over satirical post is illegal, FLAG says
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Circumstances of Beltran’s supposed violation do not fall under the scenarios where a warrantless arrest may be conducted as stated on the Rules of Criminal Procedure, FLAG said.

item.title: P10-M reward up for COVID-19 vaccine
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte has offered up to P10 million as a reward to anyone who can find a way to defeat "Public Enemy Number One."

item.title: Duterte: DOH seeks P5.2 billion to hire over 17,000 health workers
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The Department of Health is seeking P5.2 billion to hire more than 17,000 health workers who will join the government's response to the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), President Rodrigo Duterte said.

item.title: Recoveries rise to 654 as COVID-19 cases in Philippines hit 6,599
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Cases continue to pile up as the entire Luzon, including outbreak epicenter Metro Manila, entered the sixth week of the enhanced community quarantine put in place to stem the spread of the contagion.

item.title: No more warning before arrest under 'tighter' ECQ as PNP leads contact tracing
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "We need to do this because we want to mitigate the increasing risk to frontline PNP personnel," the chief of the national police said.
